docs.title: What is HelixDesk AI?
docs.text: HelixDesk AI is an intelligent IT support automation system that uses artificial intelligence and multiple AI agents working together to automatically resolve IT tickets—just like a team of IT support specialists working in harmony.

docs.title: Simple Explanation
docs.text:
Imagine you have a problem with your computer at work—maybe your email won't open, or the WiFi isn't working. Instead of:

  • Waiting hours for IT support to respond
  • Filling out long support forms
  • Explaining the same problem multiple times

You just type what's wrong in plain English, and within seconds, an AI team:

  1. Understands your problem
  2. Searches through thousands of solutions
  3. Gives you the exact fix you need
  4. Escalates to human IT if it can't help

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Natural Language Understanding

    Type problems in plain English—no technical jargon required. The system understands context and intent.

  • Multi-Agent Collaboration

    Specialized AI agents (Classifier, Knowledge Base, Notifier) work together to resolve issues efficiently.

  • Semantic Vector Search

    Powered by Azure AI Search with 1536-dimensional embeddings for accurate solution matching.

  • Automatic Escalation

    If AI can't help, human IT is notified automatically with detailed ticket information.

  • Instant Response

    Average response time: 2-5 seconds (vs. 2-5 days traditional IT support).

  • 70-85% Resolution Rate

    Automatically resolves routine IT issues, freeing IT teams for complex problems.

docs.title: Business Impact
docs.text:
For a company with 500 employees:

Metric Traditional IT With HelixDesk AI Monthly Tickets 1,000 1,000 Auto-Resolved 0 700 (70%) Response Time 2-5 days 5-10 seconds Monthly Cost $35,000 $14,500 Annual Savings - $252,000

ROI: 1,697% in Year 1

Save up to $252,000 per year while improving employee satisfaction and IT team focus.

docs.title: What is HelixDesk AI?
docs.text: HelixDesk AI (also known as SupportX AI Assist) is an intelligent IT support automation system that uses artificial intelligence and multiple AI agents working together to automatically resolve IT tickets.

docs.title: Traditional IT Support Challenges
docs.text:
• Scalability Problem

    As companies grow, IT ticket volume grows exponentially, overwhelming support teams.

  • Knowledge Fragmentation

    Solutions are scattered across wikis, documents, and tribal knowledge—hard to find and inconsistent.

  • Repetitive Work

    IT professionals waste 60-70% of time answering the same questions repeatedly.

  • Slow Response Times

    Average ticket resolution: 2-5 days. Ticket queues create bottlenecks.

  • After-Hours Issues

    No support outside business hours when problems don't sleep.

  • Inconsistent Solutions

    Different IT staff provide different answers to the same problem.

docs.title: How HelixDesk AI Addresses Each Challenge
docs.text: Challenge HelixDesk AI Solution Scalability Handles unlimited concurrent tickets—10 or 10,000 users simultaneously Knowledge Fragmentation Vector search finds the right solution from thousands in milliseconds Repetitive Work AI handles routine issues; humans focus on complex problems Slow Response Average response time: 7 seconds (vs. 48 hours traditional) 24/7 Availability Works nights, weekends, holidays—always on Consistency Same high-quality answer every time, based on verified knowledge base

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text: Think of HelixDesk AI as a team of three specialized AI assistants working together:

docs.title: Agent 1: The Classifier (The Organizer)
docs.text:
Job: Figures out what type of problem you have

Example: "Oh, this is a password reset issue, not a network problem"

Why it matters: Helps find the right solution faster by narrowing down the search

docs.title: Agent 2: The Knowledge Base Expert (The Researcher)
docs.text:
Job: Searches through all IT solutions to find the best match

How: Uses "vector search"—understands meaning, not just keywords

Example: If you say "My email won't open" and "Outlook crashes immediately", it knows these are the same problem

Result: Gives you the top 3 most relevant solutions

docs.title: Agent 3: The Escalation Manager (The Helper)
docs.text:
Job: If AI can't solve your problem, it immediately alerts human IT support

How: Sends a detailed email with your issue and a ticket ID

Result: You get human help without having to do anything extra

docs.title: The Process
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[User: My VPN won't connect] --> B[Classifier: This is a Network Issue]
    B --> C[Knowledge Base: Search for VPN solutions]
    C --> D[Found 3 solutions]
    D --> E{Did this help?}
    E -->|Yes| F[Great! Issue resolved]
    E -->|No| G[Escalate to IT with ticket ID]
    G --> H[Human IT support notified]

docs.title: Key Statistics
docs.text:
Industry Averages

  • Global IT support market: $350 billion/year
  • Average ticket volume: 1 ticket per employee per month
  • Resolution time: 2-5 days (traditional)
  • First-contact resolution: Only 30-40%
  • IT labor cost: $50-80 per hour
  • Employee productivity loss: 4-8 hours per unresolved ticket

HelixDesk AI Performance

  • Response time: 5-10 seconds
  • Resolution rate: 70-85% automated
  • Cost per ticket: ~$5 (vs. $35 traditional)
  • Availability: 24/7/365
  • Scalability: Unlimited concurrent users

docs.title: For Employees (End Users)
docs.text:
• ✅ Instant help: 5-second responses vs. 2-day wait times
  • ✅ 24/7 availability: No more waiting for business hours
  • ✅ Self-service: Empowering, no dependency on IT
  • ✅ Reduced frustration: Clear, step-by-step solutions
  • ✅ Productivity: Back to work in minutes, not days

docs.title: For IT Teams
docs.text:
• ✅ 70% ticket reduction: AI handles routine issues
  • ✅ Focus on strategic work: Infrastructure, security, projects
  • ✅ Lower burnout: Fewer repetitive questions
  • ✅ Better visibility: Automated logging and analytics
  • ✅ Scalability: Handles growth without hiring

docs.title: For Companies
docs.text:
• ✅ Cost savings: $15-30 per ticket automated
  • ✅ Employee satisfaction: Higher NPS scores
  • ✅ Compliance: Consistent, documented solutions
  • ✅ Knowledge retention: Solutions don't leave with employees
  • ✅ Data insights: Identify systemic issues

docs.title: Use Cases Beyond IT Support
docs.text:
This architecture can be adapted for:

  1. Customer Support: E-commerce returns, product questions
  2. HR Helpdesk: Benefits, leave policies, onboarding
  3. Legal Q&A: Contract templates, policy questions
  4. Medical Triage: Symptom assessment (with disclaimers)
  5. Educational Tutoring: Student questions, concept explanations
  6. Financial Advice: Account questions, transaction issues

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get HelixDesk AI running in 10 minutes!

docs.title: Prerequisites Checklist
docs.text:
Before you begin, make sure you have:

  • Python 3.13+ installed
  • Azure Account with OpenAI access
  • Git installed
  • Gmail account (for email escalation)
  • Terminal/Command Prompt access

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
HTTPSSSHGitHub CLI 
git clone https://github.com/Vkartik-3/HelixDesk-AI.git
cd helixdesk-ai

git clone git@github.com:kartikvadhawana/helixdesk-ai.git
cd helixdesk-ai

gh repo clone kartikvadhawana/helixdesk-ai
cd helixdesk-ai

docs.title: Step 2: Create Virtual Environment
docs.text:
macOS/LinuxWindows 
python3 -m venv env
source env/bin/activate

python -m venv env
env\Scripts\activate

You should see (env) in your terminal prompt.

docs.title: Step 3: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
pip install -r requirements.txt

This installs all required packages (takes 2-3 minutes).

docs.title: Step 4: Configure Environment Variables
docs.text:
1. Open the .env file in the project root
  2. Replace placeholders with your actual Azure credentials:
# Azure OpenAI Configuration
AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT=https://your-resource.openai.azure.com/
AZURE_DEPLOYMENT_NAME=gpt-4
AZURE_API_VERSION=2024-12-01-preview
AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here

# Azure AI Search Configuration
AZURE_SEARCH_ENDPOINT=https://your-search.search.windows.net
AZURE_SEARCH_KEY=your-search-admin-key-here
AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT=text-embedding-3-small

Don't Have Azure Credentials?

See the Azure Setup Guide for detailed instructions on creating Azure resources.

docs.title: Step 5: Create Search Index
docs.text:
Upload the knowledge base to Azure AI Search:

python create_and_upload_index.py

Expected output: 

Creating index...
Index created successfully.
Loading knowledge base from data/knowledge_base.json...
Preparing documents with embeddings...
100%|████████████████████████| 20/20 [00:15<00:00,  1.30it/s]
Uploading documents in batches of 10...
Batch 1 uploaded successfully.
Batch 2 uploaded successfully.
All documents uploaded successfully.

⏱️ Takes: 15-30 seconds

docs.title: Step 6: Run the Application
docs.text:
Start the Streamlit web interface:

streamlit run app.py

Expected output: 

You can now view your Streamlit app in your browser.

Local URL: http://localhost:8501
Network URL: http://192.168.1.100:8501

🎉 Success! Open your browser and go to http://localhost:8501

docs.title: Test Case 1: Simple Issue
docs.text:
1. In the text area, enter: "My VPN won't connect"
  2. Click "Resolve Now"
  3. You should see:
  4. Classification: Network Issue
  5. Solution: VPN troubleshooting steps
  6. "Did this help?" buttons

docs.title: Test Case 2: Known Issue
docs.text:
1. Enter: "I forgot my password"
  2. Click "Resolve Now"
  3. You should see:
  4. Classification: Password Reset
  5. Solution: Password reset instructions

docs.title: Test Case 3: Escalation
docs.text:
1. Enter: "My coffee machine is broken" (not in knowledge base)
  2. Click "Resolve Now"
  3. Wait for solution (might not be great)
  4. Click "No, not helpful"
  5. You should see:
  6. Ticket ID generated (e.g., TKT-A3F8D2)
  7. Escalation confirmation message
  8. Email sent to IT support

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Connection Error

Problem: openai.APIConnectionError

Solution: Check your .env file—ensure the Azure endpoint ends with / and the API key is correct.

Index Not Found

Problem: Index 'it-ticket-solutions-index' not found

Solution: Run python create_and_upload_index.py to create the index.

Module Not Found

Problem: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'streamlit'

Solution: Activate your virtual environment and run pip install -r requirements.txt

For more issues, see Troubleshooting.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
HelixDesk AI requires several environment variables to function properly. Create a .env file in the project root with the following configuration:

# Azure OpenAI Configuration
AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY=your_azure_openai_api_key
AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT=https://your-resource-name.openai.azure.com/
AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT_NAME=your_deployment_name
AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION=2024-02-15-preview

# Azure AI Search Configuration
AZURE_SEARCH_SERVICE_ENDPOINT=https://your-search-service.search.windows.net
AZURE_SEARCH_ADMIN_KEY=your_search_admin_key
AZURE_SEARCH_INDEX_NAME=helixdesk-solutions

# Email Configuration (for escalation notifications)
SMTP_SERVER=smtp.gmail.com
SMTP_PORT=587
SMTP_USERNAME=your_email@gmail.com
SMTP_PASSWORD=your_app_password
IT_ADMIN_EMAIL=it-admin@yourcompany.com

docs.title: Azure OpenAI Settings
docs.text:
• AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY: Your Azure OpenAI service API key
  • AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT: The endpoint URL for your Azure OpenAI resource
  • AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT_NAME: The name of your GPT-4 deployment
  • AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION: The API version to use

docs.title: Azure AI Search Settings
docs.text:
• AZURE_SEARCH_SERVICE_ENDPOINT: Your Azure AI Search service endpoint
  • AZURE_SEARCH_ADMIN_KEY: Admin key for Azure AI Search
  • AZURE_SEARCH_INDEX_NAME: Name of the search index (default: helixdesk-solutions)

docs.title: Email Setup
docs.text:
Configure SMTP settings for automatic escalation notifications:

  • SMTP_SERVER: SMTP server address (e.g., Gmail, Outlook)
  • SMTP_PORT: SMTP port (587 for TLS, 465 for SSL)
  • SMTP_USERNAME: Email address for sending notifications
  • SMTP_PASSWORD: App password or SMTP password
  • IT_ADMIN_EMAIL: Email address to receive escalation notifications

Gmail Users

If using Gmail, you need to create an App Password: 1. Enable 2-Step Verification on your Google Account 2. Go to Security Settings → App Passwords 3. Generate a new app password for "Mail" 4. Use this password in SMTP_PASSWORD

docs.title: Agent Configuration
docs.text:
Agents can be customized by modifying their initialization in the agents/ directory:

# agents/classifier_agent.py
classifier = AssistantAgent(
    name="Classifier",
    system_message="Your custom system message...",
    llm_config=llm_config
)

docs.title: Search Configuration
docs.text:
Customize vector search parameters in create_and_upload_index.py:

# Vector search configuration
vector_search = VectorSearch(
    algorithm_configurations=[
        HnswAlgorithmConfiguration(
            name="myHnsw",
            parameters=HnswParameters(
                m=4,  # Number of bi-directional links
                ef_construction=400,
                ef_search=500,
                metric="cosine"
            )
        )
    ]
)

docs.title: End User Guide
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you use HelixDesk AI to resolve your IT issues quickly.

docs.title: How to Submit a Ticket
docs.text:
1. Open the HelixDesk AI Application
  2. Navigate to the application URL provided by your IT department

  3. You'll see a simple chat interface

  4. Describe Your Problem

  5. Type your issue in plain English
  6. Be as specific as possible

  7. Examples:

    • "I can't access my email"
    • "WiFi is not connecting on my laptop"
    • "Printer is showing offline"

  8. Get Your Solution

  9. The AI will analyze your problem
  10. Within 5-10 seconds, you'll receive:
    • Step-by-step solution
    • Relevant screenshots or links
    • Escalation to human IT if needed

docs.title: What HelixDesk AI Can Help With
docs.text:
• Password Issues: Reset instructions, account lockouts
  • Email Problems: Access issues, configuration help
  • Network Issues: WiFi, VPN, connectivity
  • Software Issues: Installation, updates, licenses
  • Hardware Issues: Printer, monitor, keyboard problems
  • Account Access: Permissions, system access requests

docs.title: Example 1: Email Access
docs.text:
You: "I can't log into my email"

HelixDesk AI:

I'll help you resolve your email access issue. Here are the steps:

  1. Try resetting your password at portal.office.com
  2. Clear your browser cache and cookies
  3. Try accessing email in incognito mode

If this doesn't work, I'm escalating your ticket to IT support.

docs.title: Example 2: WiFi Connection
docs.text:
You: "My laptop won't connect to the office WiFi"

HelixDesk AI:

Let's troubleshoot your WiFi connection:

  1. Forget the network and reconnect
  2. Check if WiFi is enabled
  3. Restart your laptop

Here's a detailed guide: [WiFi Troubleshooting Steps]

docs.title: Tips for Better Results
docs.text:
• Be Specific: Instead of "computer broken", say "computer won't turn on"
  • Include Error Messages: Copy any error text you see
  • Mention What You've Tried: "I already restarted but still having issues"
  • Provide Context: "This started after the Windows update"

docs.title: If AI Resolves Your Issue
docs.text:
• Mark the solution as helpful
  • The ticket is automatically closed
  • No further action needed!

docs.title: If AI Cannot Help
docs.text:
• Your ticket is automatically escalated to human IT support
  • An email is sent to the IT team with your issue details
  • You'll receive a follow-up within 24 hours

docs.title: Need More Help?
docs.text: If you have questions about using HelixDesk AI, contact your IT department or refer to the FAQ.
